metadata.Title: CVE-2020-17376 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Guest.migrate in virt/libvirt/guest.py in OpenStack Nova before 19.3.1, 20.x before 20.3.1, and 21.0.0. By performing a soft reboot of an instance that has previously undergone live migration, a user may gain access to destination host devices that share the same paths as host devices previously referenced by the virtual machine on the source host. This can include block devices that map to different Cinder volumes at the destination than at the source. Only deployments allowing host-based connections (for instance, root and ephemeral devices) are affected.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-17376` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

nova-ajax-console-proxy - 2:21.2.4-0ubuntu2.1
nova-api - 2:21.2.4-0ubuntu2.1
nova-api-metadata - 2:21.2.4-0ubuntu2.1
nova-api-os-compute - 2:21.2.4-0ubuntu2.1
nova-api-os-volume - 2:21.2.4-0ubuntu2.1
nova-cells - 2:21.2.4-0ubuntu2.1
nova-common - 2:21.2.4-0ubuntu2.1
nova-compute - 2:21.2.4-0ubuntu2.1
nova-compute-kvm - 2:21.2.4-0ubuntu2.1
nova-compute-libvirt - 2:21.2.4-0ubuntu2.1
nova-compute-lxc - 2:21.2.4-0ubuntu2.1
nova-compute-qemu - 2:21.2.4-0ubuntu2.1
nova-compute-vmware - 2:21.2.4-0ubuntu2.1
nova-compute-xen - 2:21.2.4-0ubuntu2.1
nova-conductor - 2:21.2.4-0ubuntu2.1
nova-novncproxy - 2:21.2.4-0ubuntu2.1
nova-scheduler - 2:21.2.4-0ubuntu2.1
nova-serialproxy - 2:21.2.4-0ubuntu2.1
nova-spiceproxy - 2:21.2.4-0ubuntu2.1
nova-volume - 2:21.2.4-0ubuntu2.1
python3-nova - 2:21.2.4-0ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> This is only an issue when libvirt is 1.3.4 and later. On Xenial, libvirt is 1.3.1 and is not vulnerable. This is fixed in focal-updates but is not yet in -security

criterions.comment: nova package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:21.2.4-0ubuntu2.1').
